title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Last night started the 3rd arc of bleach! Crazy
Good Night movie... go for it

Son has been posting [**Book Reviews on Youtube**](https://www.youtube.com/@BRBV)**.** 

I've been trying organic outreach with 'family and friends' but competing with Sharma-ji-ki-beti who gyrates to latest bollywood tunes is hard. Really hard. 

Any suggestions on outreach for this niche gene?

As you pointed, it's a niche space. Only a small percentage of people read books and even fewer read/watch reviews. But still, I have more than a few suggestions... I'm going to assume it's your channel, even if it technically isn't.

\- Think of a new channel name, it's too generic and formulaic. Just as an example, make it just "Vijay" + surname rather than "Book Reviews by Vijay". Or think of something creative and unique. Take inspiration from other popular Youtubers. No one is going to search for your channel by name in the initial phase, people are going to search for a particular book's review and they might stumble upon your channel. And also, if later on you decide to make different content on his channel, the current one won't make any sense.

\- The titling of the videos is also quite problematic. Make the subject "the hero" of the video and not yourself. So instead of "Book review by Vijay - Drowned Wednesday..." make it "Drowned Wednesday by Garth Nix - Review". Keep it simple. No need to add your name to every title. Or even mentioning the word "book". These are obvious to the viewer.

\- Learn to make more attractive thumbnails. Take inspiration from the very best (MKBHD, Johnny Harris etc.) and apply that to your channel's content and keep it consistent. It's easier these days with AI tools. Ask yourself: "Would I click this?".

\- Production could be better and 1080p is a must these days. Learn a bit of color grading. Again, it's very easy these days. Youtube is your friend. Also the audio quality is just unacceptable, so get a dedicated microphone. If possible, add English subtitles. And make the bookshelf your background.

\- I haven't checked the actual content of the video, but these videos are only 2-3 minutes long. Try to get deeper into books' themes and characters. Don't just narrate the story. Read other people's book reviews and their approach. Try to review more popular books so there are more chances of people discovering your channel.

\- At last, check what other successful Youtubers in the same field are doing. Keep improving.

I know it seems like lot of work and maybe it is, but laziness gets only mediocre results. Good luck!

Great feedback. Thanks!

Will take note of some of these points and action them.

Watched Guardians yesterday, imo best movie this year. If you can suggest better movies than this pls recc(this year launches), genre no bar. 
***
Also quite amused listening to Adam Raguesa's Pod around Chef Gordon Ramsay. Putting this here coz he was really popular during the TV era (even in India) and people really liked his show: Kitchen Nightmares, it was even dubbed in Hindi. The podcast also talked about Marco Pierre White he is a famous chef in London although not as popular in India. 

[Why I dislike Gordon Ramsay and prefer 'today' (Spotify)](https://open.spotify.com/episode/7vKZepdTgRshYwPuafCJq1?si=VKOxk3HoRMGHTX9l6Kmkxg)
Watching The Punisher, nothing great so far

Over the weekend, I indulged in a delightful holiday where I dedicated myself to immersing in the captivating world of Westworld Season 1. Although long overdue, I successfully completed the entire season within a mere two days. However, contemplating my viewing plans, I find myself inclined to skip Season 2 and instead opt for a concise 15-minute explanatory video on YouTube to grasp the key elements and developments of that particular season. My intention is to swiftly move forward and eagerly dive into the intriguing realm of Season 3 come next Saturday.
Finished 9th season of curb your enthusiasm. Any Seinfeld fan should watch.
